title: Contributing
text: love pull requests everyone. participating project, agree abide code conduct.

title: Contributing
text: Make sure GitHub account. familiar git GitHub, take look http://happygitwithr.com/ get started. Submit post issue, assuming one already exist. Clearly describe issue, including steps reproduce bug, justification proposed improvement. Fork repository GitHub make copy repository account. use line shell terminal: git clone git@github.com:-username/haemdata.git

title: Contributing
text: make Pull Request, make sure discussed proposed change issue post team support proposed change. recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look GH Actions status making changes. README contains R-CMD-CHECK badge indicate successful build continuous integration services used package. Edit files, save often, make commits logical units, commit indicates one concept Follow style guide. Make sure write good commit messages. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s). Run tests using devtools::check() assure nothing else accidentally broken. need help unsure anything, post update issue.

title: Contributing
text: Push fork submit pull request. point ’re waiting us. like least comment pull requests within days (, typically, one business day). may suggest changes improvements alternatives. things can increase chance pull request accepted: Engage discussion issue. familiar background literature cited README Write tests pass devtools::check(). Follow code style guide. Write good commit message.

title: Roadmap
text: make get_pin() use pin versions current package release use scavenger partition Apollo add state_space labels use langevitour cohort report remove metadata SummarisedExperiments add 10X metrics scRNAseq libraries implement pointblank data dictionaries revised colour scheme ggPCA PC vs. time plots fix Isilon paths CML, AML 2016 & 2018 mRNAseq, “devel” pin update nf-core version 3.10+ remove rRNA use {babelwhale} run cutadapt consolidate everything Arrow dataframe; use tidySummarizedExperiment framework https://anna-neufeld.github.io/countsplit/ https://github.com/plger/scDblFinder https://github.com/broadinstitute/CellBender https://github.com/wmacnair/SampleQC new hexsticker? https://github.com/cxli233/SimpleTidy_GeneCoEx CoFrEE: Estimate DNA Copy Number Genome-wide RNA Expression Data https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.08.25.554898v1 https://github.com/omnideconv/immunedeconv https://shbrief.github.io/GenomicSuperSignature/ Add GEO accessions metadata_mmu.csv Investigate survex: Explainable Machine Learning Survival Analysis Investigate http://www.immune-dictionary.org/ add scRNAseq pre-leukemic mice (Yu-Husan) rMATS-turbo alternative splicing https://www.nature.com/articles/s41596-023-00944-2

title: Reference genomes
text: February 2019 human genome build (GRCh38.p13) paired GENCODE annotation Release 40/Ensembl release 106, published April 2022. downloaded Gencode May 2022.

title: Reference genomes
text: June 2020 mouse genome build (GRCm39) paired GENCODE annotation M28/Ensembl release 105, published Dec 2021. downloaded Gencode Jan 2022.

title: Reference genomes
text: GRCm38_HLT equivalent venerable mm10 mouse reference genome (GRCm38), used Cancer Research Science Advances papers. assembly originally released January 2012 longer updated; annotated Ensembl release 81, published July 2015. version used downloaded Illumina’s iGenomes 2017.

title: Reference genomes
text: Additional human leukemic transgenes concatenated genome fasta files included indexes used STAR Salmon.

title: Reference genomes
text: Genome reference files (fasta, gtf, star, salmon) located Isilon store, can accessed via HPC /ref_genome/igenomes/Homo_sapiens/GENCODE/Release40 /ref_genome/igenomes/Mus_musculus/Ensembl/GRCm38_human_leukemic_transgenes /ref_genome/igenomes/Mus_musculus/GENCODE/ReleaseM28_HLT

title: How do I...
code: library(haemdata) use_pinboard("onedrive")  gene_of_interest <- "ENSMUSG00000005672" # KIT proto-oncogene receptor tyrosine kinase (Kit)  all_mice <- get_pin("mmu_mrna_all_mice_GENCODEm28_HLT_qc.rds")  se <- subset(all_mice,     select = grepl("2018", SummarizedExperiment::colData(all_mice)$batch) )  col_data <- SummarizedExperiment::colData(se) |>     as.data.frame() |>     droplevels()  SummarizedExperiment::assay(se, "abundance") |>     tibble::rownames_to_column("gene_id") |>     dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(gene_id, gene_of_interest)) |>     tidyr::pivot_longer(!gene_id, names_to = "library_id") |>     dplyr::left_join(col_data) |>     ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(y = log2(value + 0.1), x = sample_weeks, group = mouse_id, col = treatment)) +     ggplot2::geom_line(alpha = 0.3) +     ggplot2::geom_point(alpha = 0.3) +     ggplot2::geom_smooth(ggplot2::aes(group = treatment), span = 0.4) +     ggplot2::facet_wrap("gene_id") +     ggplot2::ggtitle(glue::glue("Abundance of KIT transcripts")) +     ggplot2::ylab("log2(TPM)") +     ggplot2::xlab("Weeks") +     ggplot2::theme_minimal() +     ggplot2::theme(         axis.text.x = ggplot2::element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),         legend.title = ggplot2::element_blank()     )

title: How do I...
text: Plot proportion cell types time CML “blast crisis” single cell RNAseq dataset
code: library(haemdata) library(tidyverse) library(Seurat) library(plotly)  use_pinboard("onedrive")  start<-Sys.time() seurat_object <- get_pin("mmu_10x_blastcrisis_GENCODEm28_HLT.rds", "20231002T230117Z-02ae7") end<-Sys.time() end-start ## Time difference of 4.937246 mins # ~5 mins  metadata_mmu <- get_pin("metadata_mmu.csv", "20230907T012227Z-d3324") |>     dplyr::filter(         stringr::str_detect(cohort, "blastcrisis") &         stringr::str_detect(assay, "scRNA")) |>         dplyr::select(-matches(c("fastq","batch"))) |> unique()  metadata<-left_join(seurat_object[[]], metadata_mmu, by=c("orig.ident"="library_id"))  # Custom color palette cell_type_palette <- c(     # T-cell related group (Blue)     'T cells' = '#1f78b4',     'Tgd' = '#6baed6',     'NKT' = '#9ecae1',      # Natural Killer and related cells (Red)     'NK cells' = '#e41a1c',     'ILC' = '#ef3b2c',      # B-cell related group (Green)     'B cells' = '#31a354',     'B cells, pro' = '#74c476',      # Monocyte and Macrophage group (Purple)     'Macrophages' = '#984ea3',     'Monocytes' = '#beaed4',      # Dendritic and Granulocytes (Orange)     'DC' = '#ff7f00',     'Basophils' = '#fdbf6f',     'Neutrophils' = '#fdd0a2',     'Eosinophils' = '#fdae6b',      # Miscellaneous immune cells (Brown)     'Mast cells' = '#8c6d31',      # Stem and Stromal cells (Pink)     'Stem cells' = '#f768a1',     'Stromal cells' = '#dd3497',     'Endothelial cells' = '#ae017e',      # Not Available / Unknown (Grey)     'NA' = '#636363'     )  prepared_data <- metadata %>%     group_by(orig.ident, cell_type, sample_weeks, mouse_id) %>%     summarise(cell_count = n(), .groups = 'drop') %>%     group_by(orig.ident, sample_weeks, mouse_id) %>%     mutate(total_count = sum(cell_count)) %>%     ungroup() %>%     mutate(         proportion = cell_count / total_count,         cell_type = factor(cell_type, levels = names(cell_type_palette)))   p<-ggplot(data = prepared_data, aes(x = sample_weeks, y = proportion, color = cell_type)) +     geom_point() +     geom_smooth(method = 'loess', se = FALSE, span = 1) +  # Add trend lines     scale_y_log10() +     scale_color_manual(values = cell_type_palette) +     facet_wrap(~ mouse_id) +     labs(title = "Proportion of Cell Types by Sample Weeks and Mouse ID (Log Scale)",         x = "Sample Weeks",         y = "Proportion of Cell Types (Log Scale)") +     theme_minimal()  # Convert ggplot object to a Plotly object plotly_obj <- ggplotly(p)  # Specify the traces to remain visible visible_traces <- c('B cells', 'NK cells', 'Macrophages', 'Basophils', 'Neutrophils', 'Eosinophils', 'Mast cells')  # Iterate through traces and adjust default view for (i in 1:length(plotly_obj$x$data)) {     trace_name <- plotly_obj$x$data[[i]]$name      if (trace_name %in% visible_traces) {         plotly_obj$x$data[[i]]$visible <- TRUE     } else {         plotly_obj$x$data[[i]]$visible <- "legendonly"     } }  # Display the modified Plotly object plotly_obj

title: Missing metadata
text: Haemdata includes 949 samples 124 mice (across 1891 sequencing runs). Metadata parsed functions import_metadata.R collated make_metadata_mmu() function, sourced document.

title: Missing metadata
text: Metadata parsed many sources various formats undoubtedly require close inspection correction. Please report issues.

title: Missing metadata
text: Haemdata includes SummarisedExperiments human patients MDS (EGAD00001003891), AML patients diagnosis, remission relapse Kim et al 2020, FLT3 AML patients COH Biobank. Metadata parsed public databases great require manual inspection use.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Denis O'Meally. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: O'Meally D (2025). haemdata: R package accessing genomic data PSON AML State-transition project COH. R package version 0.0.0.9013, https://github.com/cohmathonc/haemdata.
code: @Manual{,   title = {haemdata: An R package for accessing genomic data from the PSON AML State-transition project at COH},   author = {Denis O'Meally},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9013},   url = {https://github.com/cohmathonc/haemdata}, }

what: An R package for accessing genomic data from the PSON AML State-transition project at COH
title: An R package for accessing genomic data from the PSON AML State-transition project at COH
text: package provides harmonised, preprocessed genomic data (mRNA, 10X, miRNA) : - mice collected 2016 2023; - human samples COH AML FLT3 patients; - diagnosis, remission relapse AML patients Kim et al 2020; - MDS patients & cell lines Shiozawa et al 2017. Expression data sample metadata posted Haemdatda Teams channel.

title: An R package for accessing genomic data from the PSON AML State-transition project at COH
text: See Getting started usage examples, including exporting CSV tables analysis Matlab, instance. See articles comprehensive analyses.

title: An R package for accessing genomic data from the PSON AML State-transition project at COH
text: Installation required use Haemdata, installing R package provides number useful helper functions make working data convenient within R environment. can install default version Haemdata package website (campus VPN connection required): Can’t find something previously available? Check release history.

title: An R package for accessing genomic data from the PSON AML State-transition project at COH
text: Windows users require Rtools toolchain bundle installed build libraries, including dependencies used Haemdata. Find appropriate installer version R .

title: An R package for accessing genomic data from the PSON AML State-transition project at COH
text: Frankhouser et al 2022 Science Advances Rockne et al 2020 Cancer Research

title: Update SummarisedExperiment — annotate_se
text: summarised_experiment SummarisedExperiment update sample_metadata data.frame replace amend colData multiqc_path path multiqc report extract QC metrics gtf gtf logical indicating whether extract gtf file multiqc report replace gene annotations rowData qc logical indicating whether extract QC metrics multiqc report replace amend gene annotations rowData mode one c("replace", "amend"), provided data replace amend existing elements? Default: "replace"

title: Update SummarisedExperiment — annotate_se
text: SummarisedExperiment

title: Update SummarisedExperiment — annotate_se
text: Genes associated metadata come gtf logged multiqc report. Sample metadata matched library_id ID sample_metadata table QC metrics pipeline run. multiqc path refers full QC run (qc = TRUE set run_nf_core_rnaseq(), QC metrics come {out_path}/multiqc/star_salmon/multiqc_data/multiqc_general_stats.txt. Salmon-run (qc = FALSE set run_nf_core_rnaseq()), QC metrics come {out_path}/multiqc/multiqc_data/multiqc_salmon.txt.

title: Update SummarisedExperiment — annotate_se
text: Denis O'Meally

what: Run nf-core/rnaseq pipeline on Apollo — run_nf_core_rnaseq
title: Run nf-core/rnaseq pipeline on Apollo — run_nf_core_rnaseq
text: Makes sbatch job script nf-core/rnaseq pipeline submits Apollo cluster. pipeline version specified rnaseq_release parameter _targets.R file. default parameters used pipeline, addition --pseudo_aligner salmon --deseq2_vst. Makes sbatch job script nf-core/smrnaseq pipeline submits Apollo cluster. pipeline version specified smrnaseq_release parameter _targets.R file. default parameters used pipeline. Makes sbatch job script cutadapt submits Apollo cluster, one job per library.

title: Run nf-core/rnaseq pipeline on Apollo — run_nf_core_rnaseq
code: run_nf_core_rnaseq(run_folder, sample_sheet, ref_genome, qc = TRUE)  run_nfcore_smrnaseq(   run_folder,   sample_sheet,   clip_r1_3p = NULL,   species = "mmu" )  run_cutadapt_smrna(sample_sheet)

title: Run nf-core/rnaseq pipeline on Apollo — run_nf_core_rnaseq
text: run_folder subfolder run nextflow, keeps pipeline overwriting previous runs enables -resume feature Nextflow. sample_sheet nf-core sample sheet columns sample_id, library_id, fastq_1 ref_genome nf-core reference genome, see Reference Genomes supported references qc run full QC pipeline STAR_Salmon, Salmon pseudoalignment , skipping QC steps (default: TRUE) clip_r1_3p number bases trim reads. species mmu hsa. mmu, additionally sets 3' adapter TCTGGAATTCTCGGGTGCCAAGGAACTCC. hsa, 3' adapter auto-discovered.

title: Run nf-core/rnaseq pipeline on Apollo — run_nf_core_rnaseq
text: path run script, multiqc report exists. path run script, multiqc report exists. data.frame columns library_id, fastq_1, ready used input nf-core pipeline

title: Run nf-core/rnaseq pipeline on Apollo — run_nf_core_rnaseq
text: Execution pipeline independent package build script, allowing asynchronous development. run_folder exists, created along sample_sheet.csv run_{ref_genome}.sh, submitted via sbatch. successful run detected presence multiqc report. existing run script wont overwritten function must deleted manually. title: Basic single cell QC — seurat_perform_cell_qc
